Weekly report for Friday, July 6, 2001

    Hello everyone. Hope everyone had a good 4th of July.

    I met with Waste Management for what I hope is the last time before we start our recycling program. I will have the proposal for the Board to approve on Wednesdays meeting. They are trying to work out a good plan taking into consideration our space limitations and size of campus.

    Electric express came out and bid our chandelier needs. This is the company that Common Sense uses. I have looked everywhere for an exact chandelier to replace it with and have come up with not one that has the antique finish. They all have the polished finish. I suggest utilizing the polished as they are the exact shape and size of the existing ones. More importantly, I'd like to see them changed before one of the old ones falls on someone. Please advise.

    The water fountains have also been addressed by Water Works and they have proposed a wonderful all encased unit that is secured to the bottom of the fountains. They will run approximately $400 each. I will have the proposal for you approval on Wed as well. Dryco has come out and painted the directional lines on the entrance blacktop and have installed the stop signs as well.

    Spa Masters is back logged for work and Im trying to get them out as soon as possible to fix the light and pump in south pool.

    Levy and Company will be out to our office next week to do the internal work for the 2000 audit. There is just a TON of paperwork that I am compiling for the job that is very difficult to find. But Im on it.

    The old pool chairs have been hauled away as well as a few mattresses, TV, washer dryers and the usual stuff left by the dumpsters.

    The painting touch up project is in progress as the bathrooms and the skylights are complete.

    If you have any questions, comments or reports.......you know where to find me.

    Lawrence
